PriceAdjustmentSchedule.name: PriceAdjustmentSchedule
PriceAdjustmentSchedule.description: Represents a series of discounts offered depending on your product's configuration, quantity, and when they’re purchased in combination with other products.

AdjustmentMethod.description: The method for applying tiered pricing. Possible values are: Range—All items receive the discount of the highest tier the quantity falls in. Slab—Items receive the discount defined for the tier they fall in. The default value is Range. Term-based discounts can’t be of type Slab. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.The Slab method functions in the same way as the Range method.

Description.description: Text description of the price adjustment schedule.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the price adjustment schedule is active (true) or not (false). You can change this field’s value as often as necessary. Label is Active. The default value is False.

LastReferencedDate.description: Indicates whether the price adjustment schedule has been archived (true) or not (false). This field is read-only.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

Name.description: Required. The name of the price adjustment schedule. This field is read-only. Label is Price Adjustment Schedule Name.

OwnerId.description: The Salesforce ID of the sales representative who owns the price adjustment schedule.

ScheduleType.description: Indicates how the price adjustment is determined. This field is available when Subscription Management is enabled. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later.
